metadata.title: CVE-2020-24659 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: An issue was discovered in GnuTLS before 3.6.15. A server can trigger aNULL pointer dereference in a TLS 1.3 client if a no_renegotiation alert issent with unexpected timing, and then an invalid second handshake occurs.The crash happens in the application's error handling path, where thegnutls_deinit function is called after detecting a handshake failure.

criterions.comment: gnutls28: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
